briefdescription.para: Initializes the Table Services API Library.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Initializes the Table Services API Library

listitem.para: This function MUST be called before any TBL API's are called.

briefdescription.para: Initializes the entries of a single Table Registry Record.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Initializes the contents of a single Table Registry Record to default values

listitem.para: This function is intended to be called before populating a table registry record

briefdescription.para: Validates specified handle to ensure legality.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Validates handle given by calling App to Table API. Validation includes ensuring the value is within an acceptable range and the Access Descriptor that it identifies is being "used".

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

parameterdescription.para: - Handle to be validated
Operation was performed successfully
The calling Application attempted to pass a Table handle that represented too large an index or identified a Table Access Descriptor that was not used.

briefdescription.para: Validates the Application ID associated with calling Application.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Validates Application ID of calling App. Validation consists of ensuring the AppID is between zero and #CFE_ES_MAX_APPLICATIONS.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to value that will hold AppID on return.
The AppID as obtained from CFE_ES_GetAppID
Operation was performed successfully
The calling application does not have a legitimate Application ID. Most likely cause is a failure to register with the cFE via the CFE_ES_RegisterApp function.

briefdescription.para: Determines whether handle is associated with calling Application.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Validates whether the calling application has the right to access the table identified with the given TblHandle. Validation consists of verifying the calling Application's AppID, verifying the legitimacy of the given TblHandle, and checking to make sure the Access Descriptor identified by the TblHandle is associated with the calling Application.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

parameterdescription.para: Handle of table whose access is desired.
Pointer to value that will hold AppID on return.
The AppID as obtained from CFE_ES_GetAppID
Operation was performed successfully
The calling application does not have a legitimate Application ID. Most likely cause is a failure to register with the cFE via the CFE_ES_RegisterApp function.
The calling Application attempted to pass a Table handle that represented too large an index or identified a Table Access Descriptor that was not used.
The calling application either failed when calling CFE_TBL_Register, failed when calling CFE_TBL_Share or forgot to call either one.

briefdescription.para: Determines if calling application has the right to access specified table.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Validates whether the calling application has the right to access the table identified with the given TblHandle. Validation consists of checking to make sure the Access Descriptor identified by the TblHandle is associated with the calling Application.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: Note: The TblHandle and ThisAppId parameters are assumed to be valid.

parameterdescription.para: Handle of table whose access is desired.
Application ID of Application making the call
Operation was performed successfully
The calling application either failed when calling CFE_TBL_Register, failed when calling CFE_TBL_Share or forgot to call either one.

briefdescription.para: Removes Access Descriptor from Table's linked list of Access Descriptors.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Removes the given Access Descriptor from the Linked List of Access Descriptors associated with the table specified in the Access Descriptor itself.

listitem.para: This function CAN block and should not be called by ISRs.
This function assumes the Access Descriptor is completely filled out and the TblHandle has been validated.

parameterdescription.para: Handle of Access Descriptor to be removed.
Operation was performed successfully

briefdescription.para: Obtains the data address for the specified table.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Validates the given TblHandle, finds the location of the Table data and returns the address to the data to the caller.

listitem.para: It is possible that an Application that was sharing a table would discover, upon making this call, that the table has been unregistered by another Application. In this situation, this function would return CFE_TBL_ERR_UNREGISTERED.
ThisAppId parameter is assumed to be validated.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to pointer that will hold address of data upon return.
Handle of Table whose address is needed.
AppID of application making the address request.
Address of Table Data.
Operation was performed successfully
The calling Application attempted to pass a Table handle that represented too large an index or identified a Table Access Descriptor that was not used.
The calling application either failed when calling CFE_TBL_Register, failed when calling CFE_TBL_Share or forgot to call either one.
The calling application is trying to access a table that has been unregistered.

briefdescription.para: Returns any pending non-error status code for the specified table.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Returns any pending non-error status code for the specified table.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: Note: This function assumes the TblHandle has been validated.

parameterdescription.para: Handle of Table whose pending notifications are to be returned.
Operation was performed successfully
The calling Application has identified a table that has a load pending.

The calling Application has identified a table that has been updated. NOTE: This is a nominal return code informing the calling application that the table identified in the call has had its contents updated since the last time the application obtained its address or status.

briefdescription.para: Returns the Registry Index for the specified Table Name.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Locates given Table Name in the Table Registry and returns the appropriate Registry Index.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

parameterdescription.para: - Pointer to character string containing complete Table Name (of the format "AppName.TblName").
or the Index into Registry for Table with specified name

briefdescription.para: Locates a free slot in the Table Registry.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Locates a free slot in the Table Registry.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: Note: This function assumes the registry has been locked.

parameterdescription.para: or Index into Table Registry of unused entry

briefdescription.para: Locates a free Access Descriptor in the Table Handles Array.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Locates a free Access Descriptor in the Table Handles Array.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: Note: This function assumes the registry has been locked.

parameterdescription.para: or Table Handle of unused Access Descriptor

briefdescription.para: Creates a Full Table name from application name and table name.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Takes a given Table Name and combines it with the calling Application's name to make a processor specific name of the form: "AppName.TblName"

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: Note: AppName portion will be truncated to OS_MAX_API_NAME.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to character buffer of CFE_TBL_MAX_FULL_NAME_LEN size that will be filled with the processor specific Table Name.
pointer to character string containing the Application's local name for the Table.
the Application ID of the Application making the call.
processor specific Table Name of the form "AppName.TblName".

briefdescription.para: Locks access to the Table Registry.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Locks the Table Registry to prevent multiple tasks/threads from modifying it at once.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

parameterdescription.para: Operation was performed successfully

briefdescription.para: Unlocks access to the Table Registry.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Unlocks Table Registry to allow other tasks/threads to modify the Table Registry contents.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

parameterdescription.para: Operation was performed successfully

briefdescription.para: Finds the address of a buffer compatible with the specified table.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Checks to see if the specified table has a dedicated working buffer (i.e. - is a double buffered table) or requires one from the common table buffer pool. If it requires one from the pool, it locates, locks and returns its address. If the table is double buffered, the access list is scanned to ensure that nobody is currently using the inactive buffer.

listitem.para: This function assumes the TblHandle and MinBufferSize values are legitimate.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to variable that will contain the address of the first byte of the working buffer
Pointer to Table Registry Entry for Table for whom a working buffer is to be obtained
Boolean that identifies whether this internal API function is being called by a user Application (TRUE) or by the Table Services Application (FALSE)
Address of first byte of working buffer
Operation was performed successfully
The calling Application has tried to allocate a working buffer but none were available.

briefdescription.para: Loads a table buffer with data from a specified file.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Locates the specified filename in the onboard filesystem and loads its contents into the specified working buffer.

listitem.para: This function assumes parameters have been verified.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to a working buffer that is to be loaded with the contents of the specified file
Pointer to Table Registry record for table whose buffer is to filled with data from the specified file
Pointer to ASCII string containing full path and filename of table image file to be loaded
Operation was performed successfully
The calling Application called CFE_TBL_Load with a filename that specified a file that contained more data than the size of the table OR which contained more data than specified in the table header.

The calling Application called CFE_TBL_Load with a filename that specified a file that started with the first byte of the table but contained less data than the size of the table. It should be noted that CFE_TBL_WARN_PARTIAL_LOAD also indicates a partial load (one that starts at a non-zero offset).
The calling Application tried to load a table file whose header claimed the load did not start with the first byteIt should be noted that CFE_TBL_WARN_SHORT_FILE also indicates a partial load.
The calling Application tried to load a table using a filename that was too long.
The calling Application tried to load a table using a file whose header indicated that it was for a different table.
The calling Application tried to access a table file whose standard cFE File Header was the wrong size, etc.
The calling Application tried to access a table file whose standard cFE Table File Header was the wrong size, etc.
The calling Application called CFE_TBL_Load with a filename that specified a file whose content ID was not that of a table image.
The calling Application tried to access a table file whose Subtype identifier indicated it was not a table image file.

briefdescription.para: Updates the active table buffer with contents of inactive buffer.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Copies pertinent data from working buffer (inactive buffer) to the active buffer (for single buffered tables) or just changes index to identifying the active buffer (for double buffered tables).

listitem.para: All parameters are assumed to be verified before function is called.

parameterdescription.para: Handle of Table to be updated.
Pointer to Table Registry Entry for table to be updated
Pointer to appropriate access descriptor for table-application interface
Operation was performed successfully

briefdescription.para: Sets flags in access descriptors associated with specified table.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Sets the flag in each access descriptor for a table to indicate the contents of the table have been updated.

listitem.para: All parameters are assumed to be verified before function is called.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to Table Registry Entry for table to be updated

briefdescription.para: Reads Table File Headers.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Reads Table File Headers and performs rudimentary checks on header contents to ensure the acceptability of the file format.

listitem.para: FileDescriptor is assumed to be valid

parameterdescription.para: File Descriptor, as provided by OS_fopen
Pointer to buffer to be filled with the contents of the file's standard cFE Header
Pointer to buffer to be filled with the contents of the file's standard cFE Table Header
Pointer to character string containing full path and filename of table image to be loaded
Contents of standard cFE File Header
Contents of standard cFE Table File Header
Operation was performed successfully
The calling Application tried to access a table file whose standard cFE File Header was the wrong size, etc.
The calling Application tried to access a table file whose standard cFE Table File Header was the wrong size, etc.
The calling Application called CFE_TBL_Load with a filename that specified a file whose content ID was not that of a table image.
The calling Application tried to access a table file whose Subtype identifier indicated it was not a table image file.

The selected table file failed validation for Spacecraft ID. The platform configuration file has verification of table files enabled for Spacecraft ID and an attempt was made to load a table with an invalid Spacecraft ID in the table file header.

The selected table file failed validation for Processor ID. The platform configuration file has verification of table files enabled for Processor ID and an attempt was made to load a table with an invalid Processor ID in the table file header.

briefdescription.para: Byte swaps a CFE_TBL_File_Hdr_t structure.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Converts a big-endian version of a CFE_TBL_File_Hdr_t structure to a little-endian version and vice-versa.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to table header that needs to be swapped.
The swapped header

briefdescription.para: Performs a byte swap on a uint32 integer.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Converts a big-endian uint32 integer to a little-endian uint32 integer and vice-versa.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to uint32 value to be swapped.
The swapped uint32 value

briefdescription.para: Removes TBL resources associated with specified Application.

detaileddescription.para:
cFE Core task clean up prototypes Description
This function is called by cFE Executive Services to cleanup after an Application has been terminated. It frees TBL services resources that have been allocated to the specified Application. Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
This function DOES NOT remove any critical tables associated with the specified application from the Critical Data Store.

briefdescription.para: Searches the Critical Table Registry for the given handle.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This function scans the Critical Table Registry to find the specified handle. Once located, the function returns a pointer to the appropriate Critical Table Registry Record that contains information on where the contents of the Table came from and when. If a matching record is not found, the pointer returned is NULL.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to a pointer that should be initialized with the start address of the located Critical Table Registry Record.
CDS Handle to be located in Critical Table Registry.
Pointer to the start address of the located Critical Table Registry Record. NULL if the record is not found.

briefdescription.para: Updates a CDS associated with a Critical Table.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Copies the contents of the active buffer into a previously allocated CDS associated with the table. The Critical Table Registry is also updated and copied into the CDS to keep relevant information on the source of the data contained in the table.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to Registry Record of Critical Table whose CDS needs to be updated.

briefdescription.para: When enabled, will send a manage notification command message.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Whenever an application uses the CFE_TBL_NotifyByMessage API, Table services will call this routine whenever a table requires management by the owning Application. This routine will then issue the appropriate message to the software bus.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to Registry Record of Table whose owner needs notifying.
